channel.title: SoundCloud Warning
channel.description:
After cutting 40% of their staff, SoundCloud may only have enough money to last 50 days. This could prove to be a problem for auxy users as YouTube isn't always working and in YouTube you can't turn off the screen to listen. If anybody knows of any other streaming services, please post them here. Thank you!
*Do not panic (yet) until further announcements are made*
*UPDATE* The SoundCloud staff show no plans on going out of business anytime soon.

item.title: SoundCloud Warning
item.dc:creator: Shroak
item.description:
The appeal of Soundcloud is to get young and aspiring creators to post their music out there (Though to be honest the place is VERY saturated with people who think they’re the next Chance the Rapper and stuff like that), but I agree with what you’re saying. You’re pretty much limited with what you have unless you get a Go/Go+ subscription.

Read full topic

item.title: SoundCloud Warning
item.dc:creator: GioMakyo
item.description:
To be honest, I’ve never understood the appeal of Soundcloud; it feels like they are getting creators to pay for the "privilege"of uploading content, which is actually what drives users to Soundcloud. On Bandcamp, for example, I can upload my music, people can stream it, and if they like it, they can actually pay for it and download in a number of formats. It doesn’t cost me anything unless I choose to have a pro account. Soundcloud, you quickly run out of free time, and are forced to pay for a pro account, yet you cannot monetize your downloads in anyway. I don’t get it. The musician pays to provide soundcloud with content.

Read full topic

item.title: SoundCloud Warning
item.dc:creator: Auxy
item.description:
I have some insight into what’s actually going on at SoundCloud and even though the company is going through some tough times, I’m not worried that it will go out of business. I’m actually quite excited about things they’ve decided to focus on moving forward and I think great things will come for you as creators.

item.description:
Yeah I saw that just now (being updated only recently), I dunno.

Again, don’t panic. If you can, get all your stuff onto a folder somewhere all together, just in case.

We’ll hear more about this as we get closer to the alleged “end of the 50 days”.

‎Musi - Simple Music Streaming

‎"Best free music player app and I’ve tried all of them" - FaisalBeanzi "Best music experience I have used on the App Store to date!" - Lupini66444 Musi lets you stream and organize music directly from YouTube, build playlists, share music with...

srry if i’m wrong n it’s not the right type of music app u need… thought i’d holla at ya just in case it is …lol

Read full topic

item.title: SoundCloud Warning
item.dc:creator: Shroak
item.description:
Funny thing, the TechCrunch article elaborated on this:

"[Update 7/13: SoundCloud has clumsily attempted to refute this article by issuing a statement to Variety saying our post contains “extensive inaccuracies”, yet its supposed ‘corrections’ simply repeat what we did publish, and refute something we didn’t publish.

SoundCloud writes “SoundCloud is fully funded into the fourth quarter”, which is the same quote we already included from its PR. SoundCloud writes “we continue to work with all employees who were let go to support them during this transition, with employment and financial assistance” but we never said it wouldn’t support these employees, merely that it uprooted people’s lives by hiring them and then laying them off weeks later. TechCrunch stands by its reporting.]

The fate of the world’s biggest collection of bedroom remixes, garage recordings, living room podcasts, basement DJ sets and all other manner of home-made sound is at stake. The death of SoundCloud would be a sad blow to the independent musicians who are scraping by as it is. And the sale to an exploitative corporation that sees music as at best a side hustle and at worst a loss leader could ruin this canvas for sonic creation.

That’s why it’s so worrisome that one employee of SoundCloud concluded “There’s no strategy.”"

Read full topic

item.title: SoundCloud Warning
item.dc:creator: chriswearly
item.description:
This isn’t true. It was speculative reporting, but a Variety follow up article with new information from SoundCloud shows that they have no intention to close up in October.

We should definitely keep an eye out this, but don’t panic.

Variety – 13 Jul 17

SoundCloud Responds to ‘Extensive Inaccuracies’ in Article Claiming It’s...

UPDATED: On Wednesday TechCrunch posted a long and bruising article about the popular but financially challenged streaming service SoundCloud, citing inside sources who attended an all-hands meetin…

Read full topic
